intro: Achyranthes reflexa, commonly known as the Indian mallow or slender knotweed, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in axillary inflorescences. Achyranthes reflexa is typically found in moist environments such as wetlands and riverbanks.
